dt: {bc}not stable {bc}not firm or fixed {bc}not constant: such as
{bc}lacking steadiness {bc}apt to move, sway, or fall
{bc}readily changing (as by decomposing) in chemical or physical composition or in biological activity

pt: {sc}inconstant{/sc} {sc}fickle{/sc} {sc}capricious{/sc} {sc}mercurial{/sc} {sc}unstable{/sc} mean lacking firmness or steadiness (as in purpose or devotion). {sc}inconstant{/sc} implies an incapacity for steadiness and an inherent tendency to change.
{sc}fickle{/sc} suggests unreliability because of perverse changeability and incapacity for steadfastness.

pt.t: performers discover how {it}fickle{/it} fans can be

pt: {sc}capricious{/sc} suggests motivation by sudden whim or fancy and stresses unpredictability.
{sc}mercurial{/sc} implies a rapid changeability in mood.

pt.t: made anxious by her boss's {it}mercurial{/it} temperament

pt: {sc}unstable{/sc} implies an incapacity for remaining in a fixed position or steady course and applies especially to a lack of emotional balance.

shortdef: not stable : not firm or fixed : not constant: such as
not steady in action or movement : irregular
wavering in purpose or intent : vacillating

dt: {bc}angina pectoris characterized by sudden changes (such as an increase in the severity or length of anginal attacks or a decrease in the exertion required to precipitate an attack) especially when symptoms were previously stable

shortdef: angina pectoris characterized by sudden changes (such as an increase in the severity or length of anginal attacks or a decrease in the exertion required to precipitate an attack) especially when symptoms were previously stable
